comment: He definitely was not the professor for me. He is very clearly passionate about what he does, but it almost seems like he doesn't respect that other people aren't as passionate about music than he is. If you're doing a group project, be sure to pick *decent* partners.
i took this professor for spring 2015 semester, it was a very pleasant class, if you take his notes yo will be fine on tests

The tests are extremely hard but as long as you do the work you will be fine. He does is grading so that it helps you in the end of the semester. He gives extra credit on tests and allows an extra credit concert. Only downside was the group project, make sure you pick good people. He is a great teacher. I failed most of the tests and still got an A
Not a fun class at all. His test are pretty hard, and you have to study pretty long if you want a good grade. Attendance is mandatory and some test questions are from lecture only.

He is very helpful and genuinely interested in his students' success. Not unfairtough grader at all: I have gotten As on everything, just do your job. If you're planning to take this class just so you won't have to study, don't. It's a lot of info, and you do need to study. But his classes are enjoyable and his passion for what he does shows.

It is obvious from the first day that he is passionate about music. He does not take into consideration that not everyone taking the class is interested in music. The tests and quizzes are super hard and the lectures are long and confusing. Attendance is not required but he picks 5 random classes to take attendance for a grade. He is not helpful.

You MUST study for his tests. He provides an outline for you to fill in - DO IT. This is an easy class as long as you study for the tests. Attendance is "mandatory", but he only takes attendance at a random 5 classes.
